= lcb_set_touch_callback(3couchbase)
:doctype: manpage
Trond Norbye <trond.norbye@couchbase.com>

NAME
----
lcb_set_touch_callback - Set callback for touch operations

SYNOPSIS
--------
cc [ flag ... ] file... -lcouchbase [ library ... ]

    #include <libcouchbase/couchbase.h>

    lcb_touch_callback lcb_set_touch_callback(lcb_t instance, lcb_touch_callback callback);

DESCRIPTION
-----------
lcb_set_touch_callback() is used to set a new callback function to
handle touch commands for a given libcouchbase instance.

The callback parameter is a callback function to call for each
touch response. Passing NULL as the callback function may be used to
query the current callback function.  The lcb_touch_callback is a
function with the following signature:

    void function(lcb_t instance,
                  const void* cookie,
                  lcb_error_t error,
                  lcb_touch_resp_t * resp);

instance is the libcouchbase instance that this response is called
from.  The cookie is cookie you passed to lcb_touch. error is the
error status of this operation. If the error is LCB_SUCCESS the resp
is a pointer to the result for the operation.  lcb_touch_resp_t is a
structure defined in <libcouchbase/arguments.h>:

    typedef struct {
        int version;              /* The enty in "v" to use */
        union {
            struct {
                const void *key;    /* The key this response belongs to */
                lcb_size_t nkey;    /* The number of bytes in the key */
                const void *bytes;  /* The value */
                lcb_size_t nbytes;  /* The number of bytes in the value */
                lcb_uint32_t flags; /* The flag section for the document */
                lcb_cas_t cas;      /* The CAS value for the current value */
                lcb_datatype_t datatype; /* The datatype (currently unused) */
            } v0;
        } v;
    } lcb_touch_resp_t;

RETURN VALUES
-------------
lcb_set_touch_callback() returns the previous callback function.

EXAMPLES
--------
Example 1: Query the current callback

         #include <libcouchbase/couchbase.h>

         ...
         lcb_t instance;
         ...
         lcb_touch_callback old;
         old = lcb_set_touch_callback(instance, NULL);
         ...

Example 2: Install custom callback

         #include <libcouchbase/couchbase.h>

         ...
         static void callback(lcb_t instance, const void *cookie,
                              lcb_error_t error,
                              const lcb_touch_resp_t *resp)
         {
            if (error == LCB_SUCCESS) {
               switch (resp->version) {
                   ...
                   /* handle the known formats */
                   ...
               default:
                   /* handle unknown formats */
               }
            } else {
               /* handle errors */
            }
         }

         ...
         lcb_t instance;
         ...
         lcb_set_touch_callback(instance, callback);
         ...
